Article Title: Review petition can't be allowed as 'appeal in disguise', rules Supreme Court
Article Text:
Supreme Court

Supreme Court has reiterated that proceedings initiated to review a judgment should not be confused with appeal proceedings. A bench of Justices Ahsanuddin Amanullah and S V N Bhatti cautioned that courts ought not mix up review jurisdiction with appellate jurisdiction. It said that a review petition has a limited purpose and could not be permitted to function as an appeal in disguise."The review proceedings are not by way of an appeal and have to be strictly confined to the scope and ambit of Order 47 Rule 1 of CPC. Review is not to be confused with appellate powers, which may enable an appellate court to correct all manner of errors committed by the subordinate court. In exercise of the jurisdiction under Order 47 Rule 1 of CPC, it is not permissible for an erroneous decision to be reheard and corrected," the court said.
Article Summary: Supreme court has reiterated that proceedings initiated to review a judgment should not be confused with appeal proceedings. A bench of justices ahsanuddin amanullah and s v n bhatti cautioned that courts ought not mix up review jurisdiction with appellate jurisdiction.

Article Title: WHO adds key weight-loss drugs to essential meds list
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The World Health Organization (WHO) has included popular weight-loss drugs like Semaglutide and Tirzepatide, sold in India under the brand name Wegovy and Mounjaro, respectively, in its Model List of Essential Medicines (EML).This is important because the WHO's model list of essential medicines serves as a basis for public sector procurement, supply of medicines and health insurance, and reimbursement schemes in over 150 countries, including India.If India adopts the list, it could pave the way for a sharp reduction in the prices of these drugs in the future.Currently, Wegovy, one of the most popular weight loss drugs, costs anywhere between Rs 17,000 and Rs 26,000 per month depending on the dosage. Mounjaro, another blockbuster weight-loss drug, costs anywhere between Rs 14,000 and Rs 27,000 per month depending on dosage and the route of administration. Vials are cheaper compared to Kwikpens, a pre-filled, disposable device that contains medication.According to the WHO, the high prices of drugs like Semaglutide and Tirzepatide are limiting access to these medicines. "Prioritising those who would benefit most, encouraging generic competition to drive down prices and making these treatments available in primary care - especially in underserved areas - are key to expanding access and improving health outcomes," the UN health body has said.Diabetes and obesity are two of the most urgent health challenges facing the world today. In India, studies suggest, the prevalence of overweight and obesity has gone up by over five times in the last 30 years - from approximately 53 million people in 1990 to 235 million in 2021.If action is not taken to curb this growing public health challenge, a recent study published in The Lancet warned, the overweight or obesity prevalence in the country may go up to over 520 million (projected figure) - the second highest globally.As part of broader efforts to reduce inequities in cancer care, the expert committee of WHO has also recommended increasing access to PD-1/PD-L1 immune checkpoint inhibitors.
Article Summary: The world health organization has included popular weight-loss drugs like semaglutide and tirzepatide in its model list of essential medicines. The who's model list of essential medicines serves as a basis for public sector procurement, supply of medicines and health insurance.

Article Title: Aishwarya moves Delhi HC seeking protection of personality rights
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan moved Delhi HC on Tuesday seeking to protect her personality rights and restrain online platforms from illegally using her name and images, and also AI-generated pornographic content.Justice Tejas Karia indicated that he would pass an ad interim order cautioning the defendants, and agreed to examine the suit that seeks to prevent misappropriation of various aspects of Aishwarya's personality, including her name, image, likeness, persona, and voice, from commercial misuse."There can be no right in their favour to use her images, likeness or persona. A gentleman is collecting money merely by putting her name and face... Her name and likeness are being used to satisfy someone's sexual desires... This is unfortunate," said advocate Sandeep Sethi, representing the actor.He said T-shirts and mugs with the actor's images are being sold illegally. Defendants, including unidentified parties, are making use of artificial intelligence and Deep Fake technology by morphing/superimposing the actor's face "to create distasteful videos and images of the plaintiff which are sexually explicit", the plea states.The actor has invoked right to publicity saying misappropriation of any attribute of her persona without her express permission for a commercial purpose is liable to be restrained. Allowing Aishwarya's legal team to initiate the suit before the joint registrar in Nov, high court posted the matter to Jan 15, 2026, for further proceedings.
Article Summary: Aishwarya rai bachchan moved delhi hc on tuesday seeking to protect her personality rights and restrain online platforms from illegally using her name and images. Justice tejas karia indicated that he would pass an ad interim order cautioning the defendants, and agreed to examine the suit.

Article Title: Planning to live and work in UAE? Here’s everything you need to know about the 4 main visa options
Article Text:
Anyone over 18 can work legally in the UAE, with no maximum age limit, provided employer and job meet government standards/ representative Image

Standard Work Visa: Employer-sponsored route for on-site employment

Who It’s for:

Employees in private companies, government entities, or free zones



Domestic workers like housekeepers, drivers, and caregivers, who fall under recognized categories





Application process:





Job Offer: The applicant must first secure a written job offer from a UAE-based employer. Entry Permit: Before arriving, the worker must obtain an entry permit.

Medical Check & Emirates ID: After entry, the applicant undergoes a medical check and applies for an Emirates ID.

Work Visa Issuance: The employer applies for the residency visa, linked to the employment contract and approved by the Ministry of Human Resources and Emiratisation (MoHRE).





Key requirements:





The employer must have:



A valid business license

No regulatory violations





The employee must:



Be over 18

Hold at least a high school diploma

Work in a role aligned with the company’s business activity





Remote Work Visa: Live in the UAE, work for a company abroad

Core features:





Validity: 1 year, renewable



Sponsorship: No local employer or sponsor required



Issued by: Federal Authority for Identity, Citizenship, Customs and Port Security (ICP)



Entry Window: Must enter the UAE within 60 days of visa issuance

Ability to sponsor family members, including spouse and children



Eligibility criteria:





Proof of remote employment with a company outside the UAE



Minimum monthly income of USD 3,500



Supporting documentation (employment contract, salary slips, bank statements)



Green Visa: Five-year residency for skilled talent and freelancers

Who can apply:





Freelancers/Self-employed professionals



Skilled employees



Investors/partners





Green Visa for freelancers/self-employed:





Freelance permit from MoHRE



A Bachelor’s degree or specialized diploma



Proof of income from self-employment over the past two years: Minimum AED 360,000 (USD 97,200)



Sufficient financial means for staying in the UAE





Green Visa for skilled employees:





A valid job contract



The role must be classified under occupational levels 1, 2, or 3 by MoHRE



A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification



Minimum annual salary of AED 180,000 (USD 48,600)





Additional benefits:





Sponsor family members, including spouse, children, and first-degree relatives



Male children can be sponsored until age 25; no age limit for unmarried daughters



Children of determination (with disabilities) receive residency regardless of age





Golden Visa: long-term residency for investors and exceptional achievers

Key benefits:





No sponsor required



Multiple-entry visa for 6 months to complete residency procedures



Stay outside the UAE for more than six months without invalidating the visa



Sponsor spouses and children, regardless of age



Sponsor an unlimited number of domestic workers



In case of the primary visa holder’s death, family members can stay until their own permits expire





Eligibility categories (12 official + 5 new in 2025):





Investors



Entrepreneurs



Specialised talents (e.g., doctors, researchers, creatives)



Outstanding students



Humanitarian pioneers



Frontline heroes



Nurses



Educators



Content creators



E-sports professionals



Luxury yacht owners









As global mobility continues to rise, the United Arab Emirates, particularly Dubai , has positioned itself as a hub for professionals, entrepreneurs, and remote workers. With 88% of its population made up of expats, the UAE offers a range of visa options tailored to different work profiles. Whether you're employed by a local company, working remotely for a foreign firm, freelancing, or investing, understanding the UAE’s four main work-related visa pathways, Standard, Remote Work, Green, and Golden, is essential for anyone considering relocating to the country.The standard work visa is the most common pathway for foreign nationals working in the UAE across private, government, and free zone sectors. It’s an employer-sponsored visa, usually issued for two to three years, and is renewable.There’s no maximum age for applicants. However, if the worker is over 65, the employer pays an additional AED 5,000 (USD 1,360) every two years.The UAE’s Remote Work Visa, also known as the Virtual Work Program in Dubai, allows foreign professionals to reside in the UAE while working for a non-UAE-based employer. This is ideal for digital nomads or remote professionals looking for a base in the Gulf region.The Dubai Virtual Work Program also allows remote workers to bring their families with them.Introduced to attract global talent and support flexible employment models, the Green Visa separates the work permit from the residency permit. It provides a 5-year residence, without the need for an employer sponsor, and grants extended grace periods of up to 6 months post-expiry to stay in the UAE.The Golden Visa is a prestigious long-term residence permit valid for 5 or 10 years, designed to retain investors, top professionals, and exceptional talent. It comes with multiple privileges that go beyond typical work visas.Each category has specific application procedures and approval criteria, and applicants must meet the exacting standards laid out by UAE authorities.
Article Summary: Anyone over 18 can work legally in the uae, with no maximum age limit. Employer-sponsored route for on-site employment. Green visa for skilled employees. Golden visa for investors and exceptional achievers. Dubai has positioned itself as a hub for remote workers. The uae offers a range of visa options tailored to different work profiles.

Article Title: Xbox Cloud Gaming Now Available in Cars: Microsoft and LG's Game-Changing Partnership
Article Text:
Xbox and LG put Cloud Gaming on the road

For years, gaming has been something you do at home, on your PC, console, or maybe on your phone. But now, Microsoft and LG are changing the way we think about where games can be played. In an exciting partnership, the two companies are bringing Xbox Cloud Gaming directly to cars.Imagine sitting in the backseat during a long drive and loading up Forza Horizon 5 or Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 while the miles roll by outside. With the Xbox app built into LG’s Automotive Content Platform (ACP), select internet-connected vehicles like the Kia EV3, EV5, EV6, and even the new Sportage will let passengers stream and play their favorite titles on the go.All you need is internet access, an Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription, and a Bluetooth controller. Henceforth, a car ride might not be just a journey, it can be a whole new gaming session.The collaboration between Microsoft and LG signals a major step in expanding the reach of Xbox Cloud Gaming. Already available on PCs, smartphones, and smart TVs, the service is now hitting the road, literally. This marks the first time Xbox Cloud Gaming is being directly integrated into a car’s infotainment system.The system works through LG’s Automotive Content Platform (ACP), the same webOS-based ecosystem that powers their smart TVs. In supported vehicles like the Kia EV3, passengers can open the Xbox app, log into their account, and stream games directly from the cloud.Since it’s powered by Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, the library includes blockbuster titles such as Gears of War Reloaded, The Outer Worlds 2, and the ever-popular Forza Horizon 5, an almost poetic experience when you’re playing inside a moving vehicle.Of course, cloud gaming requires a few basics. A stable internet connection is essential since all games are streamed rather than installed. A compatible Bluetooth controller is also needed, ensuring the experience feels just like playing on a console. Once connected, players can carry their progress across devices, making it possible to pick up right where they left off at home.Beyond simple entertainment, this innovation highlights Xbox’s ongoing mission to make gaming more accessible. As Christopher Lee, Xbox’s vice president of marketing, explained, this is about giving players more choices in how and where they play. Whether you’re killing time during a road trip or passing the moments while charging your EV, gaming now fits into the driving lifestyle.The partnership also makes sense for car manufacturers like Kia. With EVs becoming hubs of digital living, adding immersive entertainment options helps make long journeys or charging breaks far more engaging. It’s easy to see this becoming a selling point for families or tech-savvy drivers.This move also shows how the definition of portability in gaming is changing. Where once you needed a handheld device like the ROG Ally or Steam Deck, now all you need is a car, a screen, and an internet connection. For many players, the backseat could become the newest gaming lounge, blurring the line between travel and play.
Article Summary: Xbox and lg put cloud gaming on the road with the kia ev3, ev5, ev6, and even the new sportage. All you need is internet access, an xbox game pass ultimate subscription, and a bluetooth controller. The library includes blockbuster titles such as gears of war reloaded, the outer worlds 2, and the ever-popular forza horizon 5.

Article Title: Steve Jobs last email to himself on his Apple email ID: I do not ...
Article Text:
“I do not…” — A meditation on gratitude



Read Apple founder Steve Jobs email to himself here



From: Steve Jobs, sjobs@apple.com To: Steve Jobs, sjobs@apple.com

Date: Thursday, September 2, 2010 at 11:08PM

I grow little of the food I eat, and of the little I do grow I did not breed or perfect the seeds.

I do not make any of my own clothing. I speak a language I did not invent or refine. I did not discover the mathematics I use. I am protected by freedoms and laws I did not conceive of or legislate, and do not enforce or adjudicate.

I am moved by music I did not create myself. When I needed medical attention, I was helpless to help myself survive. I did not invent the transistor, the microprocessor, object oriented programming, or most of the technology I work with.I love and admire my species, living and dead, and am totally dependent on them for my life and well being.

Sent from my iPad

Apple founder Steve Jobs wrote a personal and moving email to himself just a year before his death. The email which offers a glimpse into the mind of the Apple visionary has now resurfaced online. The messages was sent from his official Apple email ID and was never intended for the public view, but it is now being shared via the Steve Jobs Archive .Apple founder Steve Jobs sent the email from his iPad to his own Apple ID on September 2, 2010. In the email sent, Jobs talked about the fundamental aspects of his existence that he did not create himself. Along with this, the email also mention the countless ways his life was shaped by contributions of others. “I grow little of the food I eat… I speak a language I did not invent or refine… I am moved by music I did not create myself… I love and admire my species, living and dead, and am totally dependent on them for my life and well being,” wrote Jobs.The message highlights that Jobs acknowledged the invisible network of human effort—past and present—that sustains modern life. The email concludes with a powerful and heartfelt statement that stands in stark contrast to the often-portrayed image of Jobs as a singular, self-made genius: "I love and admire my species, living and dead, and am totally dependent on them for my life and well being."The email is now available for public via the Steve Jobs Archive. It is a project launched by Laurene Powell Jobs, Tim Cook, and Jony Ive to preserve and share the legacy of Apple’s co-founder.
Article Summary: Apple founder steve jobs sent the email from his ipad to his own apple id on september 2, 2010. In the email sent, jobs talked about the fundamental aspects of his existence that he did not create himself. The message highlights that jobs acknowledged the invisible network of human effort—past and present—that sustains modern life.

Article Title: Apple announces AirPods Pro 3 with heart rate sensors, Live Translation and 8-hour battery life
Article Text:
AirPods Pro 3 can track your heart rate and calories burned

Nearly half a decade after their debut, AirPods Pro are getting refreshed for the third time, three years after their last outing. Apple has added a heart sensor, improved the sound, and enhanced the active noise cancellation.Apple says they've redesigned the airflow system inside the earbuds that widens the sound stage. The ear tips are now foam-infused, doubling the noise cancellation compared to the previous generation AirPods Pro. Apple says the difference is "night-and-day" when compared to the original AirPods Pro from 2019.The AirPods Pro 3 , in Apple's words, are the "best fitting AirPods ever." Apple said it analysed tens of thousands of ears and made each earbud smaller to fit ear canals better. To ensure a better fit, Apple will be shipping five sizes of ear tips with these. They're now also IP57 sweat and water resistant.The "awe-dropping" moment of the AirPods Pro 3 is the new heart sensor, which uses a custom photoplethysmography (PPG) sensor that "shines invisible infrared light pulsed at 256 times per second to measure light absorption in blood flow." It's the smallest sensor from Apple ever.The heart rate sensor, when paired with AirPods Pro's other sensors like accelerometers, gyroscope, and GPS, can track heart rate, calories burned, and activity (supporting up to 50 workouts). These advanced computational models work in tandem with Apple Intelligence on iPhone, and you can see all the tracked stats in the Fitness app (just like you do with Apple Watch).Workout Buddy, which is an iOS 26 feature, can make the best use of this technology and counts as one of the Apple Intelligence features. The other is Live Translation, which Apple says will help you converse with people in different languages naturally.When using Live Translation, the noise cancellation lowers the volume of the speaker so you can hear the translation clearly. That's also an example of the improved Transparency mode. So the other person knows what you're saying, you can show the live transcription on your iPhone placed horizontally, like a heads-up display.Apple says that AirPods Pro 3 will last 8 hours, up from 6 hours on the previous AirPods Pro, with ANC turned on. For those using them as hearing aids, these should last up to 10 hours.AirPods Pro 3 are priced at $249. Pre-orders open September 9, and sales begin September 19.
Article Summary: Airpods pro 3 can track your heart rate and calories burned. The ear tips are now foam-infused, doubling the noise cancellation compared to the previous generation. Apple says it analysed tens of thousands of ears and made each earbud smaller.

Article Text: MUMBAI: Former RBI executive director G Padmanabhan on Monday said govt needs to quickly take a stand on stablecoins, warning against allowing regulatory uncertainty to drift like in the case of crypto.Speaking at a curtain raiser for Global Fintech Festival 2025, Padmanabhan, now an advisor to the Payments Council of India, said India cannot ignore global developments, particularly after the US has moved ahead with its e-currency framework. Article Title: Shrimp exports: EU lists 102 new desi fishery units
Article Text: NEW DELHI: In a significant development for the country's seafood industry, the European Union (EU) has listed 102 new Indian fishery units for export from India to EU member countries. The move comes amid the backdrop of stiff tariffs imposed by the US, which is expected to hurt the country's shrimp exports and lead to job losses.The EU's decision is likely to offset some of that impact, with the new establishments finding new markets in EU, a move that is expected to help in the diversification of the country's seafood exports. "This significant expansion reflects the growing confidence in India's food safety and quality assurance systems, and marks a major step forward in enhancing market access for Indian seafood products, specially aquaculture shrimps and Cephalopods (Squid, Cuttle fish and Octopus)," said an official statement.The decision follows a series of meetings in EU and New Delhi, in which commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal and senior officials of the commerce department participated, resulting in confidence in robust Indian official control mechanisms implemented by the Export Inspection Council (EIC).Indian seafood exports meet stringent international standards, particularly those laid down by the EU and the move also reflects India's commitment to food safety, traceability, and compliance with EU regulations and strengthens India's position as a trusted supplier of high-quality seafood.The commerce department is of the view that the decision will boost export volumes, generate employment, and enhance foreign exchange earnings. This development is also expected to significantly enhance India's seafood exports to the European Union, which is one of the most lucrative and quality-sensitive markets globally.
Article Summary: The european union has listed 102 new indian fishery units for export from india to eu member countries. The move comes amid the backdrop of stiff tariffs imposed by the us, which is expected to hurt the country's shrimp exports. The decision follows a series of meetings in eu and new delhi.

Article Title: Japan's SMBC to sell Kotak Bank stake ahead of Yes Bank buy
Article Text: MUMBAI: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC) is set to sell its entire 1.7% stake in Kotak Mahindra Bank, worth over Rs 6,166 crore, through block deals on NSE and BSE. Article Title: HIRE Act 2025: Proposal of 25% tax on companies for hiring foreign workers; how will it impact India?
Article Text:
HIRE Act proposes 25% tax on companies for hiring foreign workers.

After Tariffs, Now U.S. To Deprive Indians Of H-1B Visas? Trump Aide's Big Hint

What is the HIRE Act?



Creates a 25% tax on outsourcing payments, defined as any money paid by a U.S. company or taxpayer to a foreign person whose work benefits consumers in the United States. Creates a 'Domestic Workforce Fund' to collect any money raised from the outsourcing tax, which is used to support apprenticeships and workforce development programs. Prohibits companies from deducting any outsourcing payments.

How will the HIRE Act impact India, if passed?







Amid MAGA talks of taxing companies for hiring foreign workers or banning them from hiring Indians, senator Bernie Moreno (R-Ohio) has introduced the HIRE Act (Halting International Relocation of Employment), vowing protection of American workers from jobs getting outsourced by US companies.The Act, introduced on September 5, proposes to introduce a 25 per cent tax on outsourcing payments, meaning any money paid by a US company or taxpayer to a foreign person whose work benefits consumers in the United States.“While college grads in America struggle to find work, globalist politicians and C-Suite executives have spent decades shipping good-paying jobs overseas in pursuit of slave wages and immense profits – those days are over,” said Moreno. “It’s time to fight for working class Americans and ensure they can work and retire with dignity. If companies want to hire foreign workers instead of Americans, my bill will hit them where it hurts: their pocketbooks. ”Money raised by the penalty on spending on overseas workers will be used to support apprenticeship programs in the United States as well as workforce development programs, the Act proposes.HIRE Act is only a proposed Act and it may not get passed in its existing form. A 25% tax on outsourcing will raise costs significantly, threatening India’s major export: IT and business process services. If the Act is passed, US firms would be forced to shift work onshore to get relief from the additional tax.
Article Summary: Hire act proposes 25% tax on companies for hiring foreign workers. Creates a 'domestic workforce fund' to collect any money raised from the outsourcing tax. Prohibits companies from deducting any outsourcing payments. How will the hire act impact india, if passed?
